p: A comprehensive literature review was performed between January 2015 and June 2016. References were identified using Google Scholar (in addition to the standard Google search engine), Web of Science, Scopus, and Science Direct. The key words and phrases climate change, water-related impact, agricultural pollution, vector-borne disease, waterborne disease, flooding impact, water quality, extreme event, public health, pollution control, water availability, water quality, and Pakistan were used in various combinations. The publication time period considered was between 1980 and early 2016.
